title: Intermediate Accounting for Finance
description: This intermediate level accounting course will focus on the usage of financial information from a management perspective.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: AFM 101 or BUS 127W/227W; Mathematics/Financial Analysis and Risk Management students only. Antireq: AFM 291, BUS 387W

title: Introduction to Financial Markets
description: The course introduces students to the role of finance in the global economy and aims to develop students' understanding of the basic principles of financial decision-making.

title: Principles of Economics
description: This course provides an introduction to the basic concepts and tools of micro and macro economic analysis of individuals, businesses, and government in the global world. Topics may include consumers, producers, market structures, national income accounting, unemployment, and inflation.
requirementsDescription: Prereq: Mathematics/CPA students only. Antireq: ECON 101, 102

title: Income Tax for Finance Students
description: The course is designed to provide the student with broad overview of the Canadian income tax system as it relates to corporations and individuals. [Offered: F,S]
requirementsDescription: Prereq: COMM 321; Not open to Mathematics/CPA students. Antireq: AFM 361, BUS 357W
